text: This hotel is a 2 star property with a 5-star view‚Äîand unfortunately, that view is the only real highlight.Check-In ExperienceWe arrived at 12 PM and were told our room wasn‚Äôt ready, which was understandable. We were assured that we‚Äôd receive a call when it became available‚Äîbut no call or message ever came. When we returned after 3 PM, we were shocked to find our luggage and personal belongings‚Äîincluding passports, phones, and other valuables‚Äîleft unattended in reception for three hours, completely visible to anyone walking by. We were originally told the bags would be stored securely, which clearly didn‚Äôt happen.The receptionist noticed us spotting the bags and quickly checked us in. No information was provided about the hotel, facilities, or even where or when breakfast was served. He simply stated we had been ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù to a partial view room as a gesture for our 10-year anniversary. However, I had already booked a superior room with a terrace and had specifically requested a double bed.Room IssuesWhat we received was a twin room with two single beds and a locker in between. We had to rearrange the room ourselves to make it more suitable. Given the receptionist‚Äôs attitude‚Äîacting as though we were lucky to get what we did‚Äîwe didn‚Äôt feel comfortable complaining, for fear of being moved to something worse.To make matters worse, the air conditioning didn‚Äôt function properly at night. It became increasingly warm and stuffy, and the unit just made noise without cooling the room, leaving us waking up with headaches each morning.Pool & FacilitiesThe pool area is overcrowded and poorly managed. Sunbeds are ‚Äúreserved‚Äù by guests placing towels on them from 8 AM, and these beds often go unused for hours. At a hotel marketed as luxury, this should not be acceptable. There should be a system where unused towels and items are cleared and stored, allowing fair access for all guests.The VIP cabana area is an insult to guests. You‚Äôre charged ‚Ç¨75 for a bed that faces an ugly green fence, with no food or drink included. It should either be included in the price of your stay or offered at a more reasonable rate with better value.Staff & ServiceWe witnessed rude behaviour from several staff members, particularly at breakfast. Some guests seated themselves due to a lack of staff presence, which led to visible frustration and dismissive body language from senior staff. There‚Äôs clearly a lack of hospitality training, especially among those who seem to be in supervisory roles.The overall atmosphere was chaotic and impersonal. It felt more like being herded through a system than enjoying a relaxing getaway. For a 7-night stay at ‚Ç¨2800 with only buffet breakfast, this was far from the premium experience we were expecting.Final Frustration at Check-OutTo top it all off, check-out was equally frustrating. A young staff member spoke in Portuguese to her colleague about our reservation and seemed uncertain about what to do. She then informed us we had $150 in credit‚Äîwhich we couldn‚Äôt use because we had only spent around $30 at the pool bar. This was the first time we heard anything about having credit included in our stay. No one mentioned it at check-in, reinforcing how poorly the process was handled from the beginning.Aside from the stunning view, our stay was riddled with poor service, disappointing facilities, and a lack of professionalism. Sadly, we won‚Äôt be returning, and I cannot recommend this hotel to others expecting a premium experience.
Mafalada was fantastic!!! Overall meal and experience were truly amazing. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a high end meal in the algarves.

Stable internet (15 Mbps wgich was  fast enough for Netflix and Disney, not sure about HBO Max as didn't test it).Excellent view from rooms' balcony and restaurant!Sky bar ( roof top) closes early (8pm)Deluxe Twin room with sea view and balcony was spacious enough and clean. Shower was very efficient.Indoor pool with jacuzzi.Outdoor pool with section for babies.Lots of restaurants nearby ( 5-10 min walking). I recommend \Casa Algarvia\" and \"O Cantinho\".Rent a car at the airport for ‚Ç¨25 a day at \"Drive4Fun\" to avoid additional charges.Overall 4.5 stars"

Accommodation excellent but service leaves a lot to be desired. We never found the main pool as the indication was that you had to pay for it through the spa and we weren't prepared to pay extra. Never used the spa as it is not our 'thing'. Only found the al a carte restaurant just before the end of our holiday. We'd found a very good local restaurant so weren't prepared to pay more for what could be an inferior menu. Information in the rooms was poor especially as it was a very quiet area. Their restaurant & menus with prices; bus timetable & places to visit; car hire information are all things that would be useful in rooms. We were booked in for bed and breakfast only which was superb but the way we were treated in the buffet on our first night was so bad that we left to eat outside the hotel and had we paid for half board I would have been onto the travel company immediately. This stopped us from even considering eating in the buffet again. The accommodation, cleanliness of the rooms, kettle & fridge were supplied, the balcony was great all these were superb. I feel that it is a new hotel with staff having a lot to learn.

Excellent holiday accommodation.  This was our 6th visit and looking forward to our next. Lovely pool area and well presented gardens.  Comfortable clean spacious apartments.  Very good restaurants nearby and the beach is perfect as is the adjacent boardwalk.

Amazing hotel, superb view from the room, bar or pool, great breakfast, super comfy room‚Ä¶ no complaints at all, we had a great stay! Even tho it‚Äôs winter, the warm enough weather and sunny days made it even better! We couldn‚Äôt recommend more!!

I have stayed at Herdade da Matinha twice now and have never been disappointed. Tastefully decorated and in a beautiful location, the hotel feels like a family home. Monica and Alfredo are warm and friendly people, nothing is ever too much trouble and all the staff go out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. The horse riding is great fun and Mariana is very friendly.The food is excellent, with a great selection for the breakfast buffet.On the negatives, I really can't think of very much! It's very remote (we love that, but others might not). The dinner is quite pricey, and there are no other options nearby, but the food is excellent even though you can't choose from different options as it is a set menu. Overall though a fantastic experience and we will be returning again and again!

Our second visit & we rebooked our 3rd visit before we left! There is something for everyone at Belmar Resort and the location is perfect near the Porto do Mos beach (including restaurants) and an easy 5 minute taxi/drive or 25-30 minutes walk to Lagos centro.There is a choice of pool areas to suit adults &/or families. Pool side bars with great choice of food & drinks during the day. Good quality restaurant food too. Friendly staff, great service & very comfortable, well maintained bedrooms with daily housekeeping service (we stay in a studio apartment). There is also the gym, spa & indoor pools plus some lovely panoramic walks nearby. Highly recommended!

The location is great, the staff is super helpful, the beds are comfortable, you have a locker and the rooms are spacious, they have a good kitchen and common areas,  and they offer tons of activities to socialize. What else can you ask for?As it happens a lot with hostels, especially when you go to a dom, it's a matter of luck with the people you meet. I had a great time in this sense.I would definitely recommend it.Tip: the rooms in the ground floor are noisier since they face the street, and even though they have blinds, sometimes when it's a big dorm people want the windows open for air, so ask for a room upstairs if possible.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Had a nice stay at the Dona Filipa. Breakfast was lovely as was the swimming pool with stunning views of the ocean. The Praca is literally on your doorstep! Lots of nice restaurants to choose from. My only fault is the room we had! Having seen other people‚Äôs reviews of the classic rooms on here I was hoping we wouldn‚Äôt get the same but unfortunately we did! We were on level 1 basically basement level, they were clean but are in desperate need of a refurb. The worse thing was the smell of damp in the room, it‚Äôs just fortunate that we were hardly in there. I did ask for a refurb room but was told the hotel was full but when a family member complained he got moved straight to a new room?!If you book this hotel I strongly advise you ask for a refurbished room! Apart from that a very nice stay.

The building is Nicely renovated room is small but cozy,  location is decent,  the staff are what make it amazing.  Andre and Katrina are fabulous.  The breakfast is good.  Vibe of the area is fun.  Would stay here again.   Lisbon is a nice city.

We have owned at Monte Carvoeiro for many years and the refurbishments were under way to the current high standard before CLC World became involved in the resort. The resort is managed by owners and not CLC. This is an excellent location for the area to explore and has many top restaurant on site as well as many more only 5 - 10 minutes walk away.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: We spent 8 days here and had an Ocean suite with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and living room with a dining area.   So there was plenty of space for the 5 members of our family which included our 3 year old grandson.  The suites were exceptionally clean and housekeeping did a full clean each day.  We had half board but the kitchen was equipped with everything you could possibly need to cook your own meals.  The resort is huge but the shuttle service will transport you wherever you want to go.  You would need a taxi to get to Albufeira.   As others have commented the pools are freezing cold so we migrated to the beach on several occasions, however, although the lift takes you down there is a long board walk with many steps before you get to the beach.  Not too bad going down but pretty daunting especially for a 3 year old on the way back in the heat of the day.  We were very disappointed with the food - O Grill was a buffet which was okay but not as good as we were expecting, the Corda cafe was dreadful and overcharged us which took considerable time to correct, the steak house was mediocre.  If the resort was closer to Albuferia then we would have tried other restaurants instead of half board.  We had a terrace with a tiny garden but with hindsight would have preferred a balcony suite.  The staff were pleasant and helpful.  Overall not 5 star quality more 4 star.  Would we return - unlikely because the beach was too much of a trek, the pools too cold to enjoy and the food not up to our standards.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight, it was 10 in the morning, and they immediately suggested that we enter a dining room and refresh ourselves with a breakfast  meal at their expenseIn this way they acquired our sympathy. The hotel itself is nice, the location is excellent and the staff are extraordinarily nice, the room we received was on the second floor, overlooking a noisy construction site, starting in the morning hours. My wife had a hard time with here  makeup when there was no mirror on the dressing table. Even though we stayed for 4 nights and asked for a different room we coudn't get one/.The hotel does not have a swimming pool, or SPA . I think it is suitable for 4 stars, not 5. The price itself is at least 20% higher than what appears to be a fair deal.

What to start with ? üò≤Emmanuella‚Äôs kindness?The cleanliness of the establishment?The refinement of the tables, with a different decor every day?The sumptuous breakfast with timeless decorum?The comfort of the room (bedding, bathroom, etc.)?The outdoor terrace more than welcoming?We don‚Äôt know and we strongly suggest this great experience üòâOnly happiness ü´†Marc and Nadine

Excellent family hotel for visiting the city. We stayed here for the long weekend and couldn‚Äôt fault the service. The staff were excellent. Location is very good for walking into the city. The hotel is beautifully decorated. Recommend the cocktails especially the one called ‚Äòinfame in da club‚Äô.

2nd hotel on our walking holiday. Small and exstreamly welcoming,very clean. Stylish furnishings. Room smart,coffee, tea in room bonus. Indoor pool. Buffet breakfast, Evenings meal excellent chef takes pride in presentation taste beautiful waiting staff lovely.  Tiny village 5 mins walk away. Very very pleased with our stay.

Not a 5 star hotel as described, more like a 3.5 star hotel. Hygiene standards not great. The balcony was filthy, asked twice for cleaning. Poor breakfast. The prices were expensive for the service provided! Just spent two days there but we‚Äôll not be visiting again.

stayed here for 4 nights with a friend who was working in town.  Lovely twin room with balcony.  Plenty big enough.  Free wifi.  A shame there was no tea / coffee making facilities in the room.  Staff werent overly helpful on arrival.  Normally at a 5* hotel a bell boy will be rushing out to the taxi to meet you and take your luggage.  There was no such service at the Montebelo.  The reception staff were not overly helpful.  I even had to ask where the lifts to the rooms were.  Very strange, as my experience of customer service everywhere else in Viseu was outstanding.  The indoor pool area is nice but very dimly lit.  There are nice loungers around the pool and plenty of towels.  The saunas and steam rooms were not working for the length of my stay.  Drank in the hotel bar a few times.  Ate dinner in the restaurant one night.  Had a set menu for about 20 euros which included starter, main course, dessert and a glass of wine.  The soup was tepid.  The roast veal main was very nice.  A good choice of desserts on the dessert buffet.  The breakfast buffet selection was good.  A variety of pastries, meats, cheeses, fruits, yogurts, juices, pancakes, cereals and even bacon and scrambled eggs.  Ham on the bone is carved for you if you want it.  There is spumante once you ask for the bottle to be opened.  Normal coffee is available to help yourself to, but others coffees (espresso etc) can be ordered.  I found the staff at breakfast the friendliest in the hotel.  The hotel was incredibly quiet.  Whether by the pool, at breakfast, in the bar or in the restaurant.  I'm sure i never saw more than half a dozen other people.  In a very large hotel this just felt a little eerie.  I would agree with other reviews about this really being 4* not 5.

Came with family n grandchild. Checking in was with ease n there were very helpful in giving directions to room n explaining to us the difference amenities n facilities that was available to us. Facilities n services were excellent n the rate was really great5 minutes walk to one sandy beautiful beach

Our recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Lisbon Hotel exceeded all expectations.We chose this hotel for two main reasons, both of which greatly enhanced our overall experience.Firstly, as loyal members of the Hyatt rewards program, we were able to use our points to book a suite at the hotel. The suite provided us with a much larger room than standard accommodations, and the value of the points redemption was fantastic. This allowed us to enjoy a heightened level of comfort and luxury throughout our stay.Secondly, the suite we booked came equipped with a washing machine/dryer combination unit. This feature proved to be an invaluable asset during our extended trip through Spain and Portugal, allowing us to conveniently launder our clothes without the need for external services or facilities.The property exuded a sense of freshness and cleanliness, indicative of its status as a new establishment. Moreover, the location of the hotel proved to be ideal, with major attractions such as the Tower of Belem within minutes walking distance.One of the highlights of our stay was the breathtaking view of the river that we enjoyed from our room. And you can do morning jogging along the river.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We had a lovely stay at Valverde.  It is a pretty small hotel with excellent decor and rooms.  The absolute best part about this hotel is the service.  We stayed for three nights and after the first night we were upgraded.  The classic room we were in to start was very nice but the suite was amazing!  Every person working at this hotel is willing to help.  I was sick one day and anytime someone saw me they would ask how I was feeling.  The location is pretty good, probably not the best in Lisbon but it is easy to get around everywhere so it wasn't a problem.  I would say the one thing I didn't like, which is hard to find, is that the basement level where they have breakfast smelled a little funny, like bad water.  I'm not sure what that was but it obviously didn't impact my stay too much because we absolutely loved it here and would return.  Overall this was a great experience and we really really loved all the staff!!

Really a very nice establishment.Nothing wrongAnd the person is very nice and available.  Breakfast is hearty and served until 11:00.It is very well located near a metro and close to carts to do.Really nothing wrong.
Charged me 4 EUR for simplest cheap bad tasting green olives.. the beer and the view and finishing super nice though.Poor English and a bit slow service but OKClean bathroom.Reception staff friendly.

I had a hugely enjoyable stay at The Independente over New Year's eve. It makes such a difference not staying in a generic chain in a city, particularly a beautiful city like Lisbon. I stayed in the hotel, which had a lot of quirky touches and furnishings as well as useful amenities--hairdryer and coffee machine. My room was lovely and spacious, and although my friend's room was quite a bit smaller, she had no complaints. Breakfast is on the roof terrace that doubles up as a bar and restaurant in the evenings, and was wonderful. The woman who took care of the breakfast area could not have been more friendly and accommodating. The staff are also super-friendly and helpful, more than happy to help with local recommendations and directions etc. We spent New Year's Eve in the ground floor restaurant, The Decadente, and it was a great evening and lovely to be able to just roll up to bed afterwards.Just one thing to take note of: because the Ins√≥lito bar is situated on the roof terrace, it does get noisy at night as the clientele has to go past the rooms in order to get upstairs. This did not bother me at all, but I feel it is important to point out for someone who might need peace and quiet in order to get a good night's sleep. For some reason, I was also unable to pick up the wi-fi signal in my room during my stay and ended up having to use the communal areas. I think my room might have been in a dead spot as my friend had no problems.But other than this, it was a perfect stay and I would certainly go back there if I ever return to Lisbon.

As a Platinum Elite member, I have stayed in many different Marriott properties throughout the world.  This was my very first trip to Lisbon and this Hotel.  I can tell you that my family & I had one of the most memorable stay at this hotel.  We were amazed  by the exceptional service from the entire hotel staff.  From the time we checked in, each of them went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was comfortable & enjoyable.  They were always helpful, smiling, and accommodating to all our requests.  We truly appreciated their kindness and professionalism, which made our trip even more memorable.The facilities and amenities of the hotel were top-notch, and we were impressed with the cleanliness and the attention to detail. The location was also perfect, and we were able to explore the city easily.We were celebrating my daughter's birthday on this trip.  I will never forget the smile on my daughter's face upon arrival. She was overjoyed and thrilled with the warm welcome and the special birthday surprise that the staff had arranged for her. It was a very kind gesture and made her day even more special.   I must say that the best part of the Lisbon trip was the hotel stay for my daughter.A big shout-out and my sincere gratitude to Mr. Elmar Derkitsch and Ms. Susana Magalhaes, for making great arrangements for our stay & continuously taking care of our comfort every step of the way.An easy 10 out of 10 bright stars for this hotel.

I booked this last minute as a treat for my Boyfriend's job promotion. Chris our Brazilian receptionist was amazing, he was great in ensuring we knew all the important intel.. Such as Spa treats ..Customer cocktail party and all you need to know for a great break... The Hotel is charming and very romantic. However apart Chris and his friendly attitude... I found the rest of the staff, either very corporate or just not interested... We waited at least ten minutes at the bar for a drink, while the 3 bar staff all stared blankly at a receipt... When on holiday I want the staff to create a friendly and chilled out atmosphere. .. Not as if I am checking out after a business meeting.  Also this hotel is free for kids.. so if you haven't got any you may find yourself surrounded by everyone else's.
very nice hotel surrounded by vineyard with a wonderful seasightit's a small hotel so not a hotel club like in funchal

We have just spent a week at this amazing hotel. From check in everything was amazing and the staff super friendly with nothing too much trouble.We had a sea view room which was lovely and had every amenity. Breakfast in the buffet restaurant was great, with everything from full english, smoked salmon, pastries and fruit - to Champagne. Beautiful outlook over the sea.We decided to downgrade from half board and instead visited the local restaurants in the Marina which is only a 5 minute walk away. Here you will find two amazing restaurants in particular (see my other reviews - Manifattura Di Gelato and New Era).We did two hotel organised tours while there, the hotel bus into Funchal at Euro 20.00 each and the Calheta tour at Euro 17.00 each - both thoroughly recommended.Hope to be back next year!

The hotel has easy access by car, on arrival the receptionists show you all the services of the hotel. The room with everything you need and stunning views. I couldn't try the spa and pool, but at first glance they were excellent. It will certainly be our first choice in Porto.

Stayed here in July,2016.Had a  good size(bedroom x 2approx) comfy junior suite which was great.The kitchenette was well kitted out, dining /lounge area and a balcony. Beautiful salt water pools(one heated) and an indoor poo and plenty of sunloungers with parasols . Staff were very helpful and friendly.Hotel positioned just a short incline up from the prom/harbour and close to several good restaurants. Very relaxing and enjoyable holiday can't wait to go back!

The hotel is located in the city of Lisbon and within walking distance of two subway stations. It is very clean and the staff friendly and accommodating. The food (we had half board) is excellent, both breakfast and dinner. Every course is an eye-catcher! We can recommend the PortoBay Liberdade without reservation!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Our evening started with the cocktail reception with the hotels management. We were greeted warmly and sincerely. After our cocktails on the famous Tea Terrace we were invited to our table for Dinner. What a memorable evening. Fantastic service and food. An evening to remember.I just wished some of the guests were more appropriately dressed!  Indeed the staff looked far better turned out, why would anyone think a check shirt is appropriate attire for a formal evening Dinner dance!  Hey ho!!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival with stunning sea view, the room was extremely comfortable with all the facilities you would expect from a Belmond hotel. During our stay we ate in the hotel every night either in the Cipriani restaurant or on the cocktail terrace, why would you bother to go anywhere else with such a superb setting just outside your room. The staff were all excellent and so helpful, even on the last day when we had a late flight out where we were able to stay in our room until late afternoon without wanting to charge us any extra.We will return as the island and hotel are just superb for an autumn break in the sunshine.

You can‚Äôt really go wrong with the oh-so-sumptuous Savoy. This is the second time we have stayed with them in Funchal, the first time four years ago we stayed in the presidential suite and this time we stayed in a lovely six room suite on the top floor of the rotunda.From the advance communication from the hotel and booking our fist night‚Äôs dinner through to organizing a car from and to the airport and booking all of our dinners at the town‚Äôs best restaurants, the whole team are tip-top, particularly Lucy in Guest Services.We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel, but they have a full √† la carte menu as well as a tasting menu and a wine list as long as your arm. We did use room service for lunch one afternoon when the weather was not great ‚Äì the service was speed, tasty and, in the grand scheme of room service, not too expensive!

It is impossible to leave a simple review or comment to this hotel. I only want to leave a love letter (although it‚Äôs hard to find the right words to do so).From the moment we entered the beautiful Torel Palace, my days have been overwhelmed with affection, attention, sympathy, care and mimos! That feeling you sometimes have with family or friends. Despite the constant cordiality, the humor was undoubtedly my color. The concierge Tiago is one of those people who goes beyond our needs and expectations and there was always an ‚Äúextra mile‚Äù that left us delighted.The hotel is extremely welcoming despite the imposition and beauty of the building, but the staff leave that place an even more beautiful place.As I said in a beautiful painting that was on a wall and that rejoiced me in the morning:‚ÄúThe smile you offer will return to you again‚Äù (Guerra Junqueiro). I have been offered an endless amount of them!Thank you for everything... from the bottom of my heart!

We stay at the Royal Savoy as often as we can and I am disappointment to read the review listed before mine as a home for elderly people. We are not old and certainly do not like to be judged like this. There are many return guests as this is predominately a timeshare hotel and those that visit often take great comfort in the warmth and hospitality shown by the staff mainly, because they recognise us and we recognise them. It‚Äôs simply like returning home after an absence.We enjoyed great service and super hospitality from the waiters to the reception staff, from the owners relations to the managers.  Nothing is too much trouble and although sometimes things  take a little time to happen, if there are things troubling the guests, they will try their best to help solve them.Anyway the reason for my review.We tried the buffet breakfast for the first time today and were very pleasantly surprised by the array of choices. We then added an afternoon tea to the many experiences we have not had here. My biggest regret was not taking photographs as this afternoon tea was epic.  I cannot believe I haven‚Äôt done this before and more surprisingly I‚Äôm amazed more residents haven‚Äôt tried it. The food was hands down so much better than Reid‚Äôs at a fraction of the price and the only draw back was perhaps the setting wasn‚Äôt so opulent. There was a lady playing a harp and the most delightful waitress looking after us. I‚Äôm sure if this were advertised and opened to the guests in the other hotels or passing trade, this could be a real hit. We for certain will repeat both the breakfast service and the afternoon tea again.In summary the hotel is for everyone and this week it has been wonderful to see young families and children in the pools on what has been the hottest two weeks we‚Äôve ever had in Madeira. We cannot wait to return.

Beautiful modern coastal design throughout; exquisite views of the sea and rocky cliffs; room and public areas all very clean, all-in-all, a very comfortable and relaxing stay.  Free breakfast buffet had lots of variety -- everything you could want.  I found the selection in both restaurants to be rather limited.  However, we did enjoy our meal in The One, the fine dining restaurant.  There's a number of good restaurants within a 5-minute walk, and beyond.  Highly recommended.

Hotel Gat is one of those old buildings redone to be a funky modern hotel that makes the most out of the space you have. The rooms are small in the standard european small sense, but are still functional and tidy.Clean, modern and fitted out with LCD TVs and aircon. Albeit small, the room is comfortable to be in. Bathroom is small, in typical european fashion, and while I might have complained about it before, compared to some other hotels I've stayed in, it's spacious (at least the shower is slightly separate from the toilet/basin area).Sleep was average - bed was \just\" good but the lighting from outside (the green lights from the buildings exterior) and some early morning noise took off a few marks here. Don't get me wrong - you'll sleep fine - but I don't know if you'll be able to have an extended sleep in or not.Location is spot on. It's seconds away from the local metro stop
month: and about 1-2 minutes walk to the main square. There are several supermarkets around
year: albeit not so obvious to the untrained eye at first. Likewise
extracted_date_str: the train station that takes you to Sintra is just down the road (in an unhelpful unmarked building... look out for starbucks on the inside). Anyway
sentiment_score: especially if coming/going from the airport (Take the Metro to the airport
column12: it is less than 3 EUR each and is quicker than the bus and cheaper than the taxi
column13: and lands you almost right outside the hotel).Value: Reasonable to Very Good value for money
column16: and breakfast service.Breakfast: Your typical meats
column23: however I would rank the quality of the food/ingredients as superior to most."

text: Had a 4 day bed and breakfast package staying in the Crowne Plaza Vilamoura. The staff, decor and food are all excellent. Our room had an all glass en-suite with mirrored doors. The beds are very comfortable. The TV had numerous channels.The room had a free safe, fridge, kettle, but no cups or tea or coffee plus iron and ironing board? We also had a nice view from our balcony  overlooking Quarteira fishing harbour.The hotel has an indoor pool,spa and fitness centre with a daily charge of 11 euros per person per day which is the only negative point I can report. Would definitely return.

Everything very good, I had a great holiday, everything very well clean and smelly. In the dinners there is a thematic order, every day different with variety and taste, as in the breakfast the variety is great and we have 2 showcooking going on at the same time. Liked pretty sure we will come back, highly recommend. For those who like salt water and do not want to go to the confusion of the beaches, the main swimming pool is of salt agia.

When we arrived there was green algae around the main pool walls and children√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s pool, around the children√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s pool area there were dog ends, dirt and bottle caps, this was there the 14 nights we were even after informing staff. Youngsters coming in during the early hours was a nightmare. Rooms were kept clean but could do with an upgrade, staff were friendly but management need guidance.

Stayed at  crown plaza last week of June arrived 8.30 am room was ready a big bonus . Staff very helpful lovely hotel but did not like to que  up for breakfast for 15 mins shame no adult pool for quietness . We were leaving at 6.0 am so had to be up for 5.0 am awoke to no electric had to get dressed showered & ready in darkness when told reception was told maintainance work being done nobody was informed of this and was given the tiniest torch ( was not happy )  a let down crown plaza .

I would like to dedicate a special compliment to the reception staff at Hotel Pestana Viking, who made all the difference in my stay. From the check-in moment, I was treated with a lot of cordiality and professionalism. The staff was extremely attentive, always ready to help with all my needs and doubts, making me feel welcome and at ease.I also highlight the patience and sympathy of everyone who demonstrated a huge commitment in ensuring that my experience was perfect. They were quick and efficient in resolving any request, and even offered valuable suggestions about activities and places to visit in the region.His attention to detail and care with guests make the stay even more special. Without a doubt, the Pestana Viking reception team made all the difference in my visit, and I am very grateful for that!

My wife, my son and I stayed in the Crowne Plaza for a week at the end of October and can highly recommend it.The hotel is in a great location, right next to the beach and is only a 5 to 10 minute walk from the bustling Vilamoura Marina with its large selection of restaurants and bars.The room was clean and tidy, with a nice comfy bed, adequate clothes storage space and although the shower was great, the only slight negative point regarding the room was the glass 'wall' separating the bathroom from the main room and having to lower, then raise the privacy blind every time either of us needed the toilet or a shower. This was a very minor inconvenience though and probably wouldn't bother most families.  We only ordered room service once and it was delivered to us within 20 minutes by one of the ever friendly staff.Breakfast at the hotel is a fantastic selection ranging from full 'English' type breakfast, continental ham and cheese, fruit and yogurt to several different cereals.  Queuing is not really a problem even when arriving late (after 10:15) and we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated.The hotel bar is a great place to relax, with comfy seating, two pool tables, a PS3 and several TV's showing the latest live sports and again with staff who were really friendly.The weather wasn't brilliant for half of our weeks stay, so time around the pool was limited, but as with the rest of the hotel, I couldn't fault it. There's plenty of sun beds to choose from and the hotel pool is one of the largest I've used, if a little bit chilly, which was understandable being the end of October.I don't like to go to the same resort twice as there's too much of the world to see, but if I was to go to Vilamoura again, I would certainly go back to the Crowne Plaza.

this place has great gardens in large gated grounds , good sized pools x2 great for the beach, shops and a few bars the strip is minutes away via steep hill or old town via land train √Ç¬£5 all day , the hotel is quite a large complex we had no issues with noise the food was good we went all/inc the resteruant girls were polite and friendly even the managers had time to speak to you made us feel very welcome .the outside bar was ok staff need a bit more training on how to serve beer ,cant drink half a cup of froth, our room had great sea views inc kitchen area shower and bath ,large patio doors for that breeze  but all in all we thought the whole place was excellent for us, some parts have that little touch of luxury  we have booked again to go back  later in 2022 great recommendation

Just spent 4 nights here and it was a lovely stay.  Room was nice although we were not lucky enough to get a sea view.  Room was cleaned every day. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Had a bit of trouble getting to grips with opening and locking the door into the apartment but the handy man came passed and tinkered with it which helped. Vast choice of restaurants. Pools looked clean and nice to see hot tub drained each day, not that we used it. The place is a bit of a maze but once you get familiar, easy enough to get in and out of complex. Very annoying that people leave the secure gates wide open instead of locking like the notice on the gate says. Will definitely stay here again.

Just spent a great 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza Vilamoura. There were 15 of us in total, a large group in several rooms. We were all upgraded to sea view. Twin rooms are a reasonable size, with a sunny balcony. Bathroom is open to the room with a glass wall, but you can pull down a blind. Coffee machine, but after the first 4 the Nespresso is 2 euros so take some with you. Breakfast was a good selection of fresh fruits, fresh squeezed orange juice, pastries. I didn't eat the cooked things, but am told the omelettes were v good.Pool area was busy but we managed to get enough beds every day, we preferred the grass area. Amazing, huge pool. V close to the beach too.V small gym, and v hot, so don't get expectations up for that - of the 2 bikes, one was broken! On the last day we used the spa to have a shower, which looked lovely and was well worth 5 euros.Overall a very convenient hotel for the Marina, and would stay again. Very English though and lots of crowds of girls on hols, or men golfing, and luckily v few children!

Having visited the Ocean gardens with a friend in October 2015 I took the plunge and booked a week for myself in February 2016. I had an amazing time. The staff were very helpful and answered questions and helped me with any issues. They booked a couple of trips for me quickly and efficiently.  The room was excellent and the views stunning.I am looking forward to returning again in September with my friend but would not hesitate to go again on my own.

We loved it.. we travelled with 3kids and stayed at one of the houses, with a great living room, kitchen and 3 rooms.. the service was very good and the meals at the restaurant were great. They also produce their wine and it is very good. Nice spa and outdoor swimming pool.. great place for families as the kids can ride a bike, horse and lot of space to play around.. only downside was at the check out.. they charged more than confirmed at the reservation,,

Family of 4..kids aged 18 and 15...no problems getting a sunbed...nice outdoor pool it was a bit chilly tho.. lovely lobby...rooms were ok but probably could do with being updated..never used restaurant,gym or indoor pool..10 minute stroll to strip..25 minute stroll to the old town or 5 Euros in a taxi ( well worth a visit).. Not much choice of poolside snax also a bit on the pricey side for alcohol, 3.50 Euros for a can of superbock.. good mixture of nationalities and age ranges.. supermarket just over the worms roundabout (pingo doce)..check in time isn't until 4pm, however we got in at 3pm.. there's plenty of restaurant's nearby Uzonj 200 metres down the road is fantastic... also FatCats 50 meters down the road is a great little local pub, it does good breakfasts and all the football matches are shown there.. would definitely stop here again..

Overall we were very happy with this hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor, clean and well furnished and spotless clean. Comfy bed and pillows and quiet efficient air conditioning . Our balcony had a high ridge but we did not see this as a negative. Reception staff were, welcoming and professional Room was cleaned everyday along with fresh towels. The hotel was a good base and an easy walk to both Gaia and Porto. We would not hesitate to stay again.

from the moment we saw it my husband and i fell in love with this unique hotel, we hate high rise characterless buildings and this was just the opposite, the welcome was warm and friendly, nothing too much trouble, room spotless,very honest maid who retrieved a broken piece of jewellery which i had thrown into the bin and laid it back on the dressing table! views fantastic, food good cant wait to go back!         jean and fred shropshire

The hotel was lovely, the room was very big and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Lovely sized pools and clean. However, we were very disappointed by the all inclusive. You can only get drinks from the lower bar which is quite a walk from the main pool and you cannot get all inclusive drinks from the bar at the main pool? Which I don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t understand why when you pay all inclusive you should be able to use any bar at the hotel. Also the cups are half the size than when you pay for a drink & you can only have two drinks at a time. The bar stops serving at 10:30pm and you are not allowed to take drinks to your room even though they are in plastic cups.The food doesn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have much variety especially for children. They only offer pizza, chicken nuggets or fish fingers & fries & that√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s it all week.There is entertainment for children but none for adults apart from a singer, so doesn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t really cater for younger people.Although, the hotel is a lovely hotel and very pretty at night and if your going away for a short stay I would recommend it just avoid the all inclusive because we ended up using more money than intended.

A brand new hotel in town, just 2min walk from the famous bridge, and walking distance to the city center. Comfortable rooms, nice decor, and most rooms with river views.No need to pay more to stay in the center, this hotel is also there and great value for money.

Modern rooms with all the necessary amenieties. Breakfast is not huge but sample and is  always refilled. There is a pool and also a nice terrace. Its extremely quiet and the rooms are very comfortable. Very near the centre of Cascais.

The view is very beautiful and the people very nice. The room where we stayed is a little cluttered and the decoration a little cold, in my opinion. Breakfast is pleasant, but it is time-consuming when we depend on the employees, for example to serve the juice or coffee with milk. I waited 10' for an express.

Dirty, filthy, disgusting hotel! No cleaning of the rooms, ants and little flies everywhere, rusty sun beds, dirt everywhere and sticky tables and chairs (probably from last season), no glasses for bfst, lunch or dinner, only plastic cups. Some staff tried to be friendly, but no one was ever polite. Sex, drugs and rock'n roll in Albufeira. Several times people on the road asked us if we want to buy drugs.Worst holiday ever! Definitely never again! Unfortunately I have to give 1 star to post it, I wouldn't

Truly had a wonderful weekend in Porto and great accomadtions at the PortoSense!  The apartment was more than I expected with spectacular views of the river, bridge and all the port houses across.  A great location to explore all aspects of the city and easy access on the tram out to the beaches and ocean.  From the moment I booked the staff was very responsive and was able to accomadate our early arrival along with airport transporation.

I could have easily given this hotel 5 stars with just a couple changes that seem absolutely standard for a hotel.  But unfortunately, it kind of screws up some important things, despite being very nice.GOOD- Location is awesome on the river, though this is bad if you want to be close to Bairro Alto/downtown.- Breakfast, aside from the eggs, was absolutely phenomenal.  Fresh squeezed juice and huge variety.  No pancakes or waffles, but I was very pleased anyway.- Super clean (though there was kind of a sickly sweet smell everywhere)- Great room, aside from the ridiculous lack of power outlets (more on that below).  We had kind of a balcony which was nice, and the beds were comfortable. Clean.  Huge shower and nice bathroom.- Super helpful and attentive staff.  They were absolutely above and beyond, and they helped me have fantastic voyages in Lisbon.  They went out of their way to make it easy for us.BAD- NO POWER OUTLETS IN THE ROOM. I'm not kidding or exaggerating.  Not one outlet on the wall.  I couldn't charge my phone unless I got down on my hands and knees, went down to the floor, under the desk, then pulled up a floor cover.  Under the floor cover, the TV was plugged in.  I had to unplug the TV, then I could charge ONE of our cellphones.  This oversight is so absolutely inexcusable that I can't even fathom what is going on.  The front desk even admitted that they wish the rooms had power outlets.  This is a very new hotel, so I'm totally bewildered.- Runny, watery scrambled eggs.  This is kind of the norm in Europe, so I didn't expect much else, but it still makes for a weak main course for breakfast if eggs are your thing.  Great breakfast otherwise though.- Stark, strangely empty d√É¬©cor everywhere.  There are no paintings, no plants, no pictures, no decorative items in the corners of the hotel.  Everything is black and white.  What I think is that they want us to think they were going for a minimalist theme, but in reality, it is just empty and weird, and I think they just wanted to save money on decoration.  I know this is subjective, but it is ugly and empty and devoid of decoration inside the hotel.- Rooftop pool was too cold.  It was almost like a therapeutic cold pool you would use in physical therapy.  This is also subjective, but anyone who tried to dip their toes in it promptly decided not to, and this was the middle of July, so it was definitely not for lack of heat or sun outside.

New  hotel.. very nice with large rooms. The lighting configuration could be better.. very confusing. As others have stated the executive lounge itself is a nice facility but the food offerings are the worst I have ever had at a Hilton hotel. I have never seen a bowl of cooked corn offered at other lounges ! I realize port wine is normally taken after dinner  bur since we are in the port wine capital of the world you would think they would offer a bottle of port in the lounge.. No..   Diogo was very helpful while we were there with sights etc. Good location.

Initial reaction was awe at the beauty of the property. It‚Äôs like walking into the secret garden. I actually felt that I was in the book for a moment. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ok, it wasn‚Äôt anything amazing but it will keep the hunger at bay. On the bright side if you‚Äôd rather skip breakfast there are several amazing cafes in town. Ok so to our room... we booked a double room with balcony and view. When we arrived we received a ‚Äúcomplimentary upgrade‚Äù to a villa in the back of the property. Please be advised that it‚Äôs not easy to get there.You have to descend a long flight of stairs. And you will have to climb them again when you set out for your sightseeing. While views are abundant on the property the room in the villa only had a small window and no balcony to enjoy said views. The room was quite large. The bed was comfy. However no WiFi had been set up in the room yet and there is no tv. Which I didn‚Äôt care about either bc I was there to unplug, but it bugged my husband lol. The water pressure in the shower was nice. But the bathroom has no door so stepping out is very cold. Some of the craftsmen-ship was also pretty shoddy for such a picturesque property. Overall it was a comfortable space just needed some improvement.

A comfortable, spotless and well run Hotel with excellent facilities and food.  The rooms have good space, a fabulous view with balcony overlooking Funchal.  En-suite facilities with good space, spotlessly clean and well serviced.The staff service was well up to the 5 star standards one expects.

This is a lovely place in the outskirts of the town. Situated on the hillside it gives a fabulous view of the river valley. The owners are very welcoming and the rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished. The continental breakfast was served in a nice room with a great view. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s possible to walk down the hill into town in 30-40 mins but definitely  needs taking a taxi back. Wine from the house estate is delicious and very good value at 7 euros for a bottle of their splendid red.

Everything was excellent: from the rooms to the food to the breakfasts, to the views, to the location, to the staff.The only detail I wasn't a fan of was the main entrance that I found impersonal with the white/grey colours and a lost piano in the middle. It lacks a cosy touch. If I were to stay several times in that hotel, I would be happy to return, but would find it hard to call it home. In other hotels, you can.Also, the spa area is ok, the plus is the sauna facing the river, but the pool is tiny and doesn't really allow you to swim.But those are details. The rest is great. The staff is really helpful and makes a difference.

We had a fabulous room with terrace overlooking the pool. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was a little disappointing but overall a lovely stay. Cascais is a magic place to visit and the beaches are great.

Situated in the centre of Monsaraz, Dom Nuno is comfortable & clean. The buffet breakfast is typical for the area and is entirely sufficient. The rooms are very clean and most of them offer fantastic views over the surrounding countryside. A couple of the room open up onto the cobbled main street through Monsaraz. The owners are very helpful with excellent local knowledge. A great base to explore the wider area. We have been twice and will stay again when we next visit.

We hosted our wedding at the Quinta da Marinha Lake House with 140 guests, and it was an unforgettable experience. The setup was beautiful, and everyone was served at the table during our traditional Icelandic wedding dinner. The chef and headwaiter were outstanding, working seamlessly with the master of ceremonies to make everything run perfectly.A special thanks to Jessica and Patricia, who were incredibly helpful throughout the entire year of planning. Organizing a destination wedding from Iceland could have been challenging, but they made everything smooth and stress-free. On the wedding day, everything went exactly as promised‚Äî100%.We also had about 140 guests staying at the hotel, and they were all very happy with their rooms, the food, and the drinks. The pool area and the hotel bar became wonderful spots for more informal gatherings, which our guests really enjoyed.Jessica and Patricia from the events department truly went above and beyond. They handled every request with professionalism and care, and their support made our dream wedding a reality. We couldn‚Äôt be happier with the venue and the service‚Äîit‚Äôs a fantastic choice for a wedding!

Excellent stay in a very well readapted hotel unit of old and centenary hospital. A team of very professional, empathic and available employees. Good breakfast and dinner with very good confectionery. Experience to repeat in due course.

date: Erik van de Laakwrote a review May 2019
text: Very good hotel with very friendly staff. Nice building and good swimming pool very near by the centre of Visue. I will very recomment a stay in this old redesinged hostpital. It is worth the effort and trip.

I have the obligation to be here sharing the best experience we had in Portugal, at Hotel Onyria, we were very well received and very well treated by all staffs, very careful and friendly, cleanliness and wonderful organization, but also very satisfied with the accommodation of the hotel, very comfortable everything in the room very well planned with everything we need, and with a beautiful view to the golf course and pool, and inside the hotel everything very well decorated and harmonious, we will definitely return to remember this wonderful experience üòç.

This hotel is great. Price is reasonable (September 2025). All you need, everything is super clean, comfortable bed, pleasant interior of the hotel, water pressure is excellent, water temperature stays the way you set it as long as you need.
